name: Eilan Hotel Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Very nice place, but quite expensive. Spa and workout room very well kept. Lap pool was nice but crowded. Food was excellent. Not for the casual, every day traveler! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Small conference almost overwhelmed the place. Architecture was very unique for San Antonio.
reviews.title: Nice Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was beautiful and done with excellence. The staff was so very helpful and kind. We went with a Groupon and expected maybe to have a really small room and little focus on us, However they were very focused on us and our room was beyond amazing! We cant wait to go back! Oh and the pools and spas, perfection.
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.text: For anyone wanting to stay in a top notch hotel resort, I have found it. Our first time staying at Eilan and it was nothing less than what I expect in a Luxury hotel. The view from our room looking on to the hill tops was beautiful, room and bathroom were magnificent and spotless. I had the pleasure of being accomodated by the wonderful staff that ranged from maintance personel all the way to managment. One staff member in particular by the name of Joe Lopez went above and beyond to satisify our needs and made our stay a dream. Location of the hotel is another great aspect of this property, it sits next to Six flags fiesta texas, great dinning and shopping centers, malls. You really don't have to go far for anything. Can't wait till next vacation.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary at the Eilan Hotel. The room was spacious with a fantastic view and balcony over looking the Texas hill country. The room/ bathroom amenities were luxurious and impeccably clean. The staff arranged to have a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room as a surprise for our anniversary, outstanding service all around.
reviews.title: Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I recently enjoyed a two-night stay at this stunningly gorgeous hotel. The décor was breathtaking and the ambiance was warm and inviting. Our room was immaculate and spacious. The location was extremely convenient to fabulous shopping and top-notch dining. It is without question one of the nicest properties in San Antonio!
reviews.title: Exquisite Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just celebrated our 1 year Wedding Anniversary at Eilan and it was better than we could have ever imagined. Starting at check-in, Chris B was so helpful and accommodating. Our room was beautiful and we had complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room with a sweet hand-written card welcoming us and wishing us a special anniversary. The staff was overly accommodating and everyone we spoke with was so friendly and eager to help. Kimberly at the front desk was also very sweet and helpful. We had amazing couples massages that were the best we've ever had! The food and drinks at Sustenio were so unique and delicious and again the service was impeccable. The resort pool was so amazing we felt like we were on an island somewhere. The entire trip from check-in to check-out was beyond our expectations!! I work in the hosptality industry and finding a resort that offers so many amenities and the level of customer service is few and far between. This resort was the perfect getaway and I HIGHLY recommend visiting Eilan Hotel Resort & Spa. We cannot thank the staff enough for making this the most memorable trip of our lives, and we're counting down the days til we can return!!
reviews.title: An Anniversary to Remember!

reviews.text: I had the pleasure to attend 2 days Meeting at the hotel. From the moment I have arrived to SAT and was picked up by Fred, though the check in and arrival process, the great looking rooms and amenities, it was out of this world. The food an beverage team has done and AMAZING job, including a presentation by the Exec chef and the culinary team, Philip the wine director who paired the beverages and the wait staff that was super attentive and professional. I could not rave enough about the hotel and the service. I only wish I could stay longer. Will be back with the family to enjoy more of it.
reviews.title: Outstanding, what an experience.

reviews.text: TH
reviews.title: One of my fave stay-cations

reviews.text: We stayed at the Eilan Hotel and Spa Resort for my daughter's birthday. We were blown away with the rooms and the service we received. Danielle, in the sales department, really made our stay special. Since I had told her it was my daughter's birthday, she had a candy bar set up in her room with all of her favorite candies. The hotel is plush and rich feeling but the staff is SO great! The pool area is like a tropical resort. I could lay out there for days. The servers at the pool grill and bar are fun! Eilan is very convenient to Fiesta Texas, the Shops at La Cantera and the Rim shopping area. They are all literally across the street. Treat yourself and stay here. The nice thing is even though you will feel like you are in an uber expensive luxury hotel, you won't have to pay like you are. You'll be sad when it's time to leave.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is gorgeous and quaint. The pool is beautiful as well. It is.a stones throw from Fiesta Texas, and great shopping. It is a mix use property, and there is space available for shops. I can't wait for them to open shops and eateries. :) Despite being near Fiesta Texas, this hotel is better suited for adults.
reviews.title: Eat, Drink and be Pampered

reviews.text: We spent some time hanging in the presidential suite, followed by an evening function at the hotel and I have to say - WOW! What a great place for a special occasion.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: The suite was beautiful and huge, nicely appointed and whenever anything was needed, they were right there with it (low on ice, bam! it was there). Following some afternoon football we cleaned up and headed to the patio area for the cocktail hour. Really nice wines and appetizers, great ambience and stellar service. The dinner that followed in the ballroom was exquisite and a special thank you to Hector, who was one of the best servers ever! The food was great, the place was beautiful and they even had a kids party room set up with videos and fun things for the younger pre-teen/teen crowd. A delightful evening at a beautiful venue.
reviews.title: Trying to be Grand

reviews.text: The Eilan Hotel is part of a mediterranean-esque development in the San Antonio suburbs. The development is still under construction, but the hotel is finished with the exception of some of its function rooms. The lobby and atrium are grand, but the ambiance deteriorates when you get upstairs.
reviews.title: Girls Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was slightly smaller than you'd expect in a property like this. Housekeeping was not thorough. Sheets not changed. Turn down service sporadic - on one night and not on another.
reviews.title: Fantastic.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only place I have had runnier scrambled eggs was in Britain.
reviews.title: The perfect stay-cation

reviews.text: I have now stayed at Eilan a few times and like the fact the the rooms are extremely quiet and the finishes are top notch. I don't normally notice linens, but in this case the mattress and linen quality is five star. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms spotless. If you are meeting for business, the hotel is perfect.
reviews.title: Quality from wall to wall

reviews.text: Only complaint is the poor cell phone service.
reviews.title: Great potential

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Eilan is a beautiful property but looks like a ghost town. It's fairly new so perhaps the word hasn't gotten out. It's conveniently located on La Cantera Pkwy next to Six Flags Fiesta Texas. They have built adjacent condos and mixed use retail but they too appear mostly empty. Our room was very nice. Tastefully decorated, very comfortable bed, safe, Keurig coffee maker, large shower, etc. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Pool is nice. My biggest complaint is the ridiculous long walk (up and down a hill) to self park. Overall we had a good experience. I'm interested in returning when the retail has filled in a bit and there's more to do on site.
reviews.title: Beautiful and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Eilan in June 2013 for 3 nights. It a beautiful setting, clean rooms and great gym. However, the air conditioner is set to throw cold air directly on the bed.
reviews.title: Not much other than a room!

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, however, the hotel was almost empty, so they had plenty of time to get us attention. It's just next to Six Flags and La Cantera shopping, so perfect for families.
reviews.title: Very high class resort

description: The Eilan Hotel Resort & Spa, located in the Hill Country of San Antonio, Texas, announces its much anticipated opening as the area’s newest sustainable luxury boutique hotel. The 165 guestroom and suite hotel is part of Eilan, San Antonio’s newest 120 acre mixed use development also comprising of high end residences, retail outlets, and commercial space. The Eilan Hotel Resort and Spa provides its guests a total luxury hotel experience bringing together the intimacy of a boutique setting with the grandeur of a resort. Guests will have access to a wide array of features including a fitness center with lap pool and golf simulation room; 24 hour in room dining; spa facilities with 10 unique treatment rooms; six private lush gardens; exquisite event and executive meeting facilities; and a fine dining experience at the Stephan Pyles inspired Sustenio.
